roadmap.title:
So what's next
for Dash?
roadmap.description: Plenty of reasons to get excited just around the corner. Read and get prepared.

masternodes.title: Masternodes in General:
masternodes.description: Dash is best known as the first cryptocurrency with a focus on user-friendly payments and transaction speed.
masternodes.highlight: What many people do not know is that these features are implemented on top of a network of dedicated servers known as masternodes
masternodes.descriptionEnd: , which gives rise to many exciting features not available on conventional blockchains.

hosted.title: Option 1: Hosted masternode
hosted.description: Since operating your own server requires a certain level knowledge of blockchains and Linux server operating systems, several community members offer
hosted.highlight: dedicated hosting solutions for a fee.
hosted.descriptionEnd: Taking advantage of these services means the user only needs to provide the masternode collateral and pay the hosting fee in order to receive payment from the block reward.

whatIsDash.question: What is Dash?
whatIsDash.answer: Dash is an open-source cryptocurrency that was forked from Bitcoin in January 2014. The name "Dash" comes from "Digital Cash." It focuses on being a fast, cheap global payments network with features like InstantSend (transactions confirm in 1-2 seconds), optional privacy through PrivateSend, and extremely low fees (typically $0.01-$0.02 per transaction).

whoInvented.question: Who invented Dash?
whoInvented.answer: Based on the Bitcoin project, Dash was launched on January 18, 2014 by founder Evan Duffield. The first few years of development saw Dash develop a focus on speed and fungibility, making it an excellent and practical alternative to cash, both online and at the point of sale in shops and restaurants.

whatUsedFor.question: What is Dash used for?
whatUsedFor.answer: Dash is used for fast, private, and low-cost payments both online and at physical point-of-sale locations. It's designed to work like digital cash — transactions confirm in seconds and can be immediately spent by the recipient. Dash is also used for cross-border payments, remittances, and as a store of value in regions with unstable local currencies.

whoControls.question: Who controls Dash?
whoControls.answer: No single entity controls Dash. It operates as one of the world's oldest Decentralized Autonomous Organizations (DAO). Decisions are made collectively by masternode operators who vote on proposals for network changes, marketing, and development. The network self-funds through a treasury system that allocates 10% of block rewards to approved projects.

bugBounty.title: Bug Bounty Program
bugBounty.description: The Dash Core Group Bug Bounty Program allows developers to discover and resolve bugs before the general public is aware of such bugs, preventing incidents of widespread abuse.

getDash.title: Get Dash
getDash.description: Dash is easy to buy or receive online, from friends, or at an ATM near you.

dashpayAndroid.title:
DashPay
Android
dashpayAndroid.description: The DashPay Wallet supports advanced Dash features like CoinJoin and usernames, plus real-world spending tools, staking, a merchant map, and more

vultisig.title: Vultisig
vultisig.description: Vultisig is an open-source, seedless multi-chain crypto wallet leveraging TSS and MPC for secure asset management

exodus.title: Exodus
exodus.description: Exodus is multi-asset wallet with built-in exchanges, local key/data encryption, no accounts/servers.

edgeWallet.title: Edge Wallet
edgeWallet.description: Edge Wallet provides maximum security while keeping simplicity, allowing all users to easily manage, transfer and exchange their currencies.

stackWallet.title: Stack Wallet
stackWallet.description: Stack Wallet is a multicoin, non-custodial wallet for Dash and other digital currencies with built-in exchange features.

dashElectrum.title: Dash Electrum
dashElectrum.description: Dash Electrum is a lightweight desktop wallet that provides fast and secure Dash transactions with advanced features.

zyptoWallet.title: Zypto Wallet
zyptoWallet.description: Zypto Wallet is a simple and secure multi-currency wallet designed for ease of use and maximum security.

trustWallet.title: Trust Wallet
trustWallet.description: Trust Wallet is a secure, open-source, decentralized and anonymous crypto wallet with support for multiple blockchains.

unstoppableWallet.title: Unstoppable Wallet
unstoppableWallet.description: Unstoppable Wallet is a fully decentralized wallet for independent and secure management of crypto assets.

guardaWallet.title: Guarda Wallet
guardaWallet.description: Guarda Wallet is a secure non-custodial cryptocurrency storage supporting 50+ blockchains and 400K+ tokens.

downloadsHero.title: Downloads
downloadsHero.description: List of all the wallets for different platforms where you can manage your Dash. Everything listed here is officially approved to be secure for your usage.

mobileWallets.title: Mobile Wallets
mobileWallets.description1: A range of Dash mobile wallets are available, each with different features and security.
mobileWallets.description2: These wallets run from mobile devices, such as your phone or tablet.

getGoing.title: Get Going!
getGoing.description: Grab a coffee, buy a plane ticket, or pay your phone bill. Dash is growing and is accepted by new businesses every day.
